questions.question: What is the difference between UI and UX?
options: UI is about visual design, UX is about user experience
UI is about user experience, UX is about visual design
They are exactly the same thing
UI is about coding, UX is about design
questions.explanation: UI (User Interface) focuses on the visual design and layout, while UX (User Experience) focuses on the overall experience and usability.

questions.question: What is a wireframe?
options: A final design mockup
A basic visual guide that represents the skeletal framework of a website
A type of animation
A color scheme
questions.explanation: A wireframe is a basic visual guide that represents the skeletal framework of a website, showing the layout and structure without design elements.

questions.question: What is the purpose of user testing?
options: To make the design look pretty
To evaluate a product by testing it with real users
To check if the code works
To measure website speed
questions.explanation: User testing helps evaluate a product by testing it with real users to identify usability issues and gather feedback.

questions.question: What is a user persona?
options: A real user of the product
A fictional character representing a target user
A type of design element
A marketing strategy
questions.explanation: A user persona is a fictional character representing a target user, based on research and data about real users.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a design system?
options: To make designs look consistent
To store user data
To track website analytics
To manage server resources
questions.explanation: A design system is a collection of reusable components and guidelines that help maintain consistency across a product's design.
